Constructor Detail

FileFinder

public FileFinder()
Creates a new instace of the FileFinder class to locate files in the file system. It initializes the file to path Hashtable to cache lookups for quick retrieval on subsequent duplicate searches. Default contructor for this class.

FileFinder

public FileFinder(boolean findall,
                  boolean ignorecase,
                  boolean recurse,
                  boolean stats,
                  boolean verbose,
                  java.io.PrintStream printer)
Creates a new instace of the FileFinder class to locate files in the file system. It initializes the file to path Hashtable to cache lookups for quick retrieval on subsequent duplicate searches.
Parameters:
findall - is a boolean value determing if all instances of the file should be found.
ignorecase - is a boolean value indicating the FileFinder should ignore case when comparing the file with the files in the file system.
recurse - is a boolean used to specify the subdirectoris of the basepath should be search for the file as well.
stats - is a boolean giving overall program running statistics if true, false otherwise.
verbose - is a boolean value indicating that the search operation should be traced.
printer:Ljava.io.PrintStream - used to output the trace on verbose operation.
Method Detail

locateFile

public java.io.File[] locateFile()
locateFile traverses the local file system for the file in question.
Returns:
a [Ljava.io.File array of the path(s) found.

locateFile

public java.io.File[] locateFile(java.lang.String file,
                                 java.lang.String basepath)
locateFile traverses the local file system for the file in question.
Parameters:
file:Ljava.lang.String - parameter indicating the file to search for.
path:Ljava.io.File - is the basepath from which to start looking for the desired file.
Returns:
a [Ljava.io.File array of the path(s) found.
